column1: # Copyright 2004-2018 H2 Group. Multiple-Licensed under the MPL 2.0

column4: TEXT

column3:
SELECT [ TOP term ] [ DISTINCT | ALL ] selectExpression [,...]
FROM tableExpression [,...] [ WHERE expression ]
[ GROUP BY expression [,...] ] [ HAVING expression ]
[ { UNION [ ALL ] | MINUS | EXCEPT | INTERSECT } select ]
[ ORDER BY order [,...] ]
[ { LIMIT expression [ OFFSET expression ] [ SAMPLE_SIZE rowCountInt ] }
    | { [ OFFSET expression { ROW | ROWS } ]
    [ { FETCH { FIRST | NEXT } expression { ROW | ROWS } ONLY } ] } ]
[ FOR UPDATE ]
column4: Selects data from a table or multiple tables.

column3:
INSERT INTO tableName
{ [ ( columnName [,...] ) ]
    { VALUES { ( { DEFAULT | expression } [,...] ) } [,...]
        | [ DIRECT ] [ SORTED ] select } } |
    { SET { columnName = { DEFAULT | expression } } [,...] }
column4: Inserts a new row / new rows into a table.

column3:
UPDATE tableName [ [ AS ] newTableAlias ] SET
{ { columnName = { DEFAULT | expression } } [,...] } |
    { ( columnName [,...] ) = ( select ) }
[ WHERE expression ] [ ORDER BY order [,...] ] [ LIMIT expression ]
column4: Updates data in a table.

column3: DELETE [ TOP term ] FROM tableName [ WHERE expression ] [ LIMIT term ]
column4: Deletes rows form a table.
Backs up the database files to a .
Calculates a simple expression.

column3:
EXPLAIN { [ PLAN FOR ] | ANALYZE }
{ select | insert | update | delete | merge }
column4: Shows the execution plan for a statement.
Updates existing rows, and insert rows that don't exist.

column3:
MERGE INTO targetTableName [ [AS] targetAlias]
USING { ( select ) | sourceTableName }[ [AS] sourceAlias ]
ON ( expression )
[ WHEN MATCHED THEN [ update ] [ delete] ]
[ WHEN NOT MATCHED THEN insert ]
column4: Updates or deletes existing rows, and insert rows that don't exist.

column3:
RUNSCRIPT FROM fileNameString scriptCompressionEncryption
[ CHARSET charsetString ]
column4: Runs a SQL script from a file.

column3:
SCRIPT [ SIMPLE ] [ NODATA ] [ NOPASSWORDS ] [ NOSETTINGS ]
[ DROP ] [ BLOCKSIZE blockSizeInt ]
[ TO fileNameString scriptCompressionEncryption
    [ CHARSET charsetString ] ]
[ TABLE tableName [, ...] ]
[ SCHEMA schemaName [, ...] ]
column4: Creates a SQL script from the database.

column3:
SHOW { SCHEMAS | TABLES [ FROM schemaName ] |
    COLUMNS FROM tableName [ FROM schemaName ] }
column4: Lists the schemas, tables, or the columns of a table.

column3:
WITH [ RECURSIVE ] { name [( columnName [,...] )] AS ( select ) [,...] }
{ select | insert | update | merge | delete | createTable }
column4: Can be used to create a recursive or non-recursive query (common table expression).

column3: ALTER INDEX [ IF EXISTS ] indexName RENAME TO newIndexName
column4: Renames an index.

column3: ALTER SCHEMA [ IF EXISTS ] schema RENAME TO newSchemaName
column4: Renames a schema.

column3:
ALTER SEQUENCE [ IF EXISTS ] sequenceName
[ RESTART WITH long ]
[ INCREMENT BY long ]
[ MINVALUE long | NOMINVALUE | NO MINVALUE ]
[ MAXVALUE long | NOMAXVALUE | NO MAXVALUE ]
[ CYCLE long | NOCYCLE | NO CYCLE ]
[ CACHE long | NOCACHE | NO CACHE ]
column4: Changes the parameters of a sequence.

column3:
ALTER TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName ADD [ COLUMN ]
{ [ IF NOT EXISTS ] columnName columnDefinition
    | ( { columnName columnDefinition | constraint } [,...] ) }
[ { { BEFORE | AFTER } columnName } | FIRST ]
column4: Adds a new column to a table.

column3: ALTER TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName ADD constraint [ CHECK | NOCHECK ]
column4: Adds a constraint to a table.

column3:
ALTER TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName RENAME oldConstraintName
TO newConstraintName
column4: Renames a constraint.

Changes the data type of a column, rename a column,
change the identity value, or change the selectivity.

column3:
ALTER TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName DROP COLUMN [ IF EXISTS ]
columnName [,...] | ( columnName [,...] )
column4: Removes column(s) from a table.

column3:
ALTER TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName DROP
{ CONSTRAINT [ IF EXISTS ] constraintName | PRIMARY KEY }
column4: Removes a constraint or a primary key from a table.

column3:
ALTER TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName SET REFERENTIAL_INTEGRITY
{ FALSE | TRUE } [ CHECK | NOCHECK ]
column4: Disables or enables referential integrity checking for a table.

column3: ALTER TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName RENAME TO newName
column4: Renames a table.

column3: ALTER USER userName ADMIN { TRUE | FALSE }
column4: Switches the admin flag of a user on or off.

column3: ALTER USER userName RENAME TO newUserName
column4: Renames a user.

column3: ALTER USER userName SET { PASSWORD string | SALT bytes HASH bytes }
column4: Changes the password of a user.

column3: ALTER VIEW [ IF EXISTS ] viewName RECOMPILE
column4: Recompiles a view after the underlying tables have been changed or created.
Updates the selectivity statistics of tables.
Sets the comment of a database object.

column3: CREATE AGGREGATE [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newAggregateName FOR className
column4: Creates a new user-defined aggregate function.

column3:
CREATE ALIAS [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newFunctionAliasName [ DETERMINISTIC ]
[ NOBUFFER ] { FOR classAndMethodName | AS sourceCodeString }
column4: Creates a new function alias.

column3: CREATE CONSTANT [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newConstantName VALUE expression
column4: Creates a new constant.

column3:
CREATE DOMAIN [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newDomainName AS dataType
[ DEFAULT expression ] [ [ NOT ] NULL ] [ SELECTIVITY selectivity ]
[ CHECK condition ]
column4: Creates a new data type (domain).

column3:
CREATE
{ [ UNIQUE ] [ HASH | SPATIAL] INDEX [ [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newIndexName ]
    | PRIMARY KEY [ HASH ] }
ON tableName ( indexColumn [,...] )
column4: Creates a new index.

column3:
CREATE [ FORCE ] [ [ GLOBAL | LOCAL ] TEMPORARY ]
LINKED TABLE [ IF NOT EXISTS ]
name ( driverString, urlString, userString, passwordString,
[ originalSchemaString, ] originalTableString ) [ EMIT UPDATES | READONLY ]
column4: Creates a table link to an external table.

column3: CREATE ROLE [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newRoleName
column4: Creates a new role.

column3:
CREATE SCHEMA [ IF NOT EXISTS ] name
[ AUTHORIZATION ownerUserName ]
[ WITH tableEngineParamName [,...] ]
column4: Creates a new schema.

column3:
CREATE SEQUENCE [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newSequenceName
[ START WITH long ]
[ INCREMENT BY long ]
[ MINVALUE long | NOMINVALUE | NO MINVALUE ]
[ MAXVALUE long | NOMAXVALUE | NO MAXVALUE ]
[ CYCLE long | NOCYCLE | NO CYCLE ]
[ CACHE long | NOCACHE | NO CACHE ]
column4: Creates a new sequence.

column3:
CREATE [ CACHED | MEMORY ] [ TEMP | [ GLOBAL | LOCAL ] TEMPORARY ]
TABLE [ IF NOT EXISTS ] name
[ ( { columnName columnDefinition | constraint } [,...] ) ]
[ ENGINE tableEngineName ]
[ WITH tableEngineParamName [,...] ]
[ NOT PERSISTENT ] [ TRANSACTIONAL ]
[ AS select ]
column4: Creates a new table.
Creates a new trigger.

column3:
CREATE USER [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newUserName
{ PASSWORD string | SALT bytes HASH bytes } [ ADMIN ]
column4: Creates a new user.

column3:
CREATE [ OR REPLACE ] [ FORCE ] VIEW [ IF NOT EXISTS ] newViewName
[ ( columnName [,...] ) ] AS select
column4: Creates a new view.
Drops an existing user-defined aggregate function.
Drops an existing function alias.

Drops all existing views, tables, sequences, schemas, function aliases, roles,
user-defined aggregate functions, domains, and users (except the current user).
Drops a constant.
Drops a data type (domain).
Drops an index.
Drops a role.

column3: DROP SCHEMA [ IF EXISTS ] schemaName [ RESTRICT | CASCADE ]
column4: Drops a schema.
Drops a sequence.

column3: DROP TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] tableName [,...] [ RESTRICT | CASCADE ]
column4: Drops an existing table, or a list of tables.
Drops an existing trigger.
Drops a user.

column3: DROP VIEW [ IF EXISTS ] viewName [ RESTRICT | CASCADE ]
column4: Drops an existing view.
Removes all rows from a table.
Flushes the data to disk.

Flushes the data to disk and and forces all system buffers be written
to the underlying device.
Commits a transaction.
Sets the resolution of an in-doubt transaction to 'commit'.
Grants rights for a table to a user or role.

column3: GRANT ALTER ANY SCHEMA TO userName
column4: Grant schema altering rights to a user.

column3: GRANT roleName TO { PUBLIC | userName | roleName }
column4: Grants a role to a user or role.
Displays the help pages of SQL commands or keywords.
Prepares committing a transaction.
Removes rights for a table from a user or role.

column3: REVOKE roleName FROM { PUBLIC | userName | roleName }
column4: Removes a role from a user or role.
Rolls back a transaction.
Sets the resolution of an in-doubt transaction to 'rollback'.
Create a new savepoint.
Updates a user-defined variable.
This setting can help solve the SQL injection problem.

column3: SET AUTOCOMMIT { TRUE | ON | FALSE | OFF }
column4: Switches auto commit on or off.
Sets the size of the cache in KB (each KB being 1024 bytes) for the current database.

This command should not be used directly by an application, the statement is
executed automatically by the system.

Sets the collation used for comparing BINARY columns, the default is SIGNED
for version 1.

Allows the overriding of the builtin system date/time functions
for unit testing purposes.
Sets the collation used for comparing strings.
This feature is only available for the PageStore storage engine.
Sets the event listener class.
Sets the delay for closing a database if all connections are closed.

Sets the default lock timeout (in milliseconds) in this database that is used
for the new sessions.
Sets the default table storage type that is used when creating new tables.
Switched the database to exclusive mode (1, 2) and back to normal mode (0).

If IGNORECASE is enabled, text columns in newly created tables will be
case-insensitive.
Sets the object used to serialize and deserialize java objects being stored in column of type OTHER.
Sets the lazy query execution mode.
Sets the transaction log mode.
Sets the lock mode.
Sets the lock timeout (in milliseconds) for the current session.
Sets the maximum size of an in-place LOB object.
Sets the maximum size of the transaction log, in megabytes.
The maximum number of rows in a result set that are kept in-memory.
The maximum number of undo records per a session that are kept in-memory.
Sets the maximum memory used for large operations (delete and insert), in bytes.

column3: SET MODE { REGULAR | DB2 | DERBY | HSQLDB | MSSQLSERVER | MYSQL | ORACLE | POSTGRESQL }
column4: Changes to another database compatibility mode.
Enabled (1) or disabled (0) multi-threading inside the database engine.
Enabled (1) or disabled (0) the result reuse optimization.
Changes the password of the current user.
Disabled or enables query statistics gathering for the whole database.
Set the maximum number of entries in query statistics meta-table.
Set the query timeout of the current session to the given value.
Disabled or enables referential integrity checking for the whole database.
This property is only used when using the MVStore storage engine.
Sets the password salt and hash for the current user.
Changes the default schema of the current connection.
Changes the schema search path of the current connection.
Sets the throttle for the current connection.
Sets the trace level for file the file or system out stream.
Sets the maximum trace file size.
Enables (1) or disables (0) the per session undo log.
Set the maximum delay between a commit and flushing the log, in milliseconds.

This statement closes all open connections to the database and closes the
database.

column3:
yearField | monthField | dayOfMonthField
    | hourField | minuteField | secondField
    | millisecondField | microsecondField | nanosecondField
    | timezoneHourField | timezoneMinuteField
    | dayOfWeekField | isoDayOfWeekField
    | weekOfYearField | isoWeekOfYearField
    | quarterField | dayOfYearField | epochField
column4: Fields for EXTRACT, DATEADD, and DATEDIFF functions.
Year.
Month (1-12).
Day of month (1-31).
Minute (0-59).
Second (0-59).
Millisecond (0-999).
Microsecond (0-999999).
Nanosecond (0-999999999).
Timezone hour (from -18 to +18).
Timezone minute (from -59 to +59).
Day of week (1-7).
ISO day of week (1-7).
Week of year (1-53).
ISO week of year (1-53).
Quarter (1-4).
Day of year (1-366).
For TIMESTAMP values number of seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 in local time zone.
An alias is a name that is only valid in the context of the statement.
Value or condition.
An array of values.
A boolean value.
A binary value.

column3:
CASE expression { WHEN expression THEN expression } [...]
[ ELSE expression ] END
column4: Returns the first expression where the value is equal to the test expression.

column3:
CASE { WHEN expression THEN expression} [...]
[ ELSE expression ] END
column4: Returns the first expression where the condition is true.
Only the algorithm AES ("AES-128") is supported currently.

column3:
dataType [ VISIBLE | INVISIBLE ]
[ { DEFAULT expression | AS computedColumnExpression } ]
[ ON UPDATE expression ] [ [ NOT ] NULL ]
[ { AUTO_INCREMENT | IDENTITY } [ ( startInt [, incrementInt ] ) ] ]
[ SELECTIVITY selectivity ] [ COMMENT expression ]
[ PRIMARY KEY [ HASH ] | UNIQUE ] [ CHECK condition ]
column4: Default expressions are used if no explicit value was used when adding a row.
Comments can be used anywhere in a command and are ignored by the database.
Comparison operator.

column3: operand [ conditionRightHandSide ] | NOT condition | EXISTS ( select )
column4: Boolean value or condition.

column3:
compare { { { ALL | ANY | SOME } ( select ) } | operand }
    | IS [ NOT ] NULL
    | IS [ NOT ] [ DISTINCT FROM ] operand
    | BETWEEN operand AND operand
    | IN ( { select | expression [,...] } )
    | [ NOT ] [ LIKE | ILIKE ] operand [ ESCAPE string ]
    | [ NOT ] REGEXP operand
column4: The right hand side of a condition.

column3:
[ constraintNameDefinition ]
{ CHECK expression
    | UNIQUE ( columnName [,...] )
    | referentialConstraint
    | PRIMARY KEY [ HASH ] ( columnName [,...] ) }
column4: Defines a constraint.
Defines a constraint name.

column3:
charsetString [, fieldSepString [, fieldDelimString [, escString [, nullString]]]]]
    | optionString
column4: Optional parameters for CSVREAD and CSVWRITE.

column3:
intType | booleanType | tinyintType | smallintType | bigintType | identityType
    | decimalType | doubleType | realType | dateType | timeType | timestampType
    | timestampWithTimeZoneType | binaryType | otherType | varcharType
    | varcharIgnorecaseType | charType | blobType | clobType | uuidType
    | arrayType | enumType
column4: A data type definition.
A date literal.
A decimal number with fixed precision and scale.
A digit.
A string starts and ends with two dollar signs.
Value or condition.
A value or a numeric factor.

column3: { { digit | a-f | A-F } { digit | a-f | A-F } } [...]
column4: The hexadecimal representation of a number or of bytes.
A number written in hexadecimal notation.

column3: columnName [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS { FIRST | LAST } ]
column4: Indexes this column in ascending or descending order.
The maximum integer number is 2147483647, the minimum is -2147483648.
Names are not case sensitive.
NULL is a value without data type and means 'unknown value'.
The maximum length of the number depends on the data type used.
The data type of a numeric value is always the lowest possible for the given value.
A value or a concatenation of values.

column3: { int | expression } [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS { FIRST | LAST } ]
column4: Sorts the result by the given column number, or by an expression.
Quoted names are case sensitive, and can contain spaces.

column3:
FOREIGN KEY ( columnName [,...] )
REFERENCES [ refTableName ] [ ( refColumnName [,...] ) ]
[ ON DELETE referentialAction ] [ ON UPDATE referentialAction ]
column4: Defines a referential constraint.

column3: CASCADE | RESTRICT | NO ACTION | SET { DEFAULT | NULL }
column4: The action CASCADE will cause conflicting rows in the referencing (child) table to be deleted or updated.

column3:
[ COMPRESSION { DEFLATE | LZF | ZIP | GZIP } ]
[ CIPHER cipher PASSWORD string ]
column4: The compression and encryption algorithm to use for script files.
An expression in a SELECT statement.
A string starts and ends with a single quote.
A value or a numeric sum.
Joins a table.
A list of rows that can be used like a table.

column3:
value
    | columnName
    | ?[ int ]
    | NEXT VALUE FOR sequenceName
    | function
    | { - | + } term
    | ( expression )
    | select
    | case
    | caseWhen
    | tableAlias.columnName
    | userDefinedFunctionName
column4: A value.
A time literal.
A timestamp literal.

column3:
TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE 'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss[.nnnnnnnnn]
[Z | { - | + } timeZoneOffsetString | timeZoneNameString ]'
column4: A timestamp with time zone literal.
A literal value of any date-time data type.

column3: string | dollarQuotedString | numeric | dateAndTime | boolean | bytes | array | null
column4: A literal value of any data type, or null.
Possible values: -2147483648 to 2147483647.
Possible values: TRUE and FALSE.
Possible values are: -128 to 127.
Possible values: -32768 to 32767.
Auto-Increment value.

column3: { DECIMAL | NUMBER | DEC | NUMERIC } ( precisionInt [ , scaleInt ] )
column4: Data type with fixed precision and scale.
A floating point number.
A single precision floating point number.
The time data type.
The date data type.

column3:
{ TIMESTAMP [ ( precisionInt ) ] [ WITHOUT TIME ZONE ]
    | DATETIME | SMALLDATETIME }
column4: The timestamp data type.
The timestamp with time zone data type.

column3:
{ BINARY | VARBINARY | LONGVARBINARY | RAW | BYTEA }
[ ( precisionInt ) ]
column4: Represents a byte array.
This type allows storing serialized Java objects.

column3:
{ VARCHAR | LONGVARCHAR | VARCHAR2 | NVARCHAR
    | NVARCHAR2 | VARCHAR_CASESENSITIVE} [ ( precisionInt ) ]
column4: A Unicode String.
Same as VARCHAR, but not case sensitive when comparing.
A Unicode String.

column3:
{ BLOB | TINYBLOB | MEDIUMBLOB | LONGBLOB | IMAGE | OID }
[ ( precisionInt ) ]
column4: Like BINARY, but intended for very large values such as files or images.

column3:
{ CLOB | TINYTEXT | TEXT | MEDIUMTEXT | LONGTEXT | NTEXT | NCLOB }
[ ( precisionInt ) ]
column4: CLOB is like VARCHAR, but intended for very large values.
Universally unique identifier.
An array of values.
A type with enumerated values.
A spatial geometry type, based on the "org.locationtech.jts" library.

column3: AVG ( [ DISTINCT ] { numeric } ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The average (mean) value.
The bitwise AND of all non-null values.
The bitwise OR of all non-null values.
Returns true if all expressions are true.
Returns true if any expression is true.

column3: COUNT( { * | { [ DISTINCT ] expression } } ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The count of all row, or of the non-null values.

column3:
GROUP_CONCAT ( [ DISTINCT ] string
[ ORDER BY { expression [ ASC | DESC ] } [,...] ]
[ SEPARATOR expression ] ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: Concatenates strings with a separator.

column3:
ARRAY_AGG ( [ DISTINCT ] string
[ ORDER BY { expression [ ASC | DESC ] } [,...] ] )
[ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: Aggregate the value into an array.
The highest value.
The lowest value.

column3: SUM( [ DISTINCT ] { numeric } ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The sum of all values.
Estimates the selectivity (0-100) of a value.

column3: STDDEV_POP( [ DISTINCT ] numeric ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The population standard deviation.

column3: STDDEV_SAMP( [ DISTINCT ] numeric ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The sample standard deviation.

column3: VAR_POP( [ DISTINCT ] numeric ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The population variance (square of the population standard deviation).

column3: VAR_SAMP( [ DISTINCT ] numeric ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The sample variance (square of the sample standard deviation).

column3: MEDIAN( [ DISTINCT ] value ) [ FILTER ( WHERE expression ) ]
column4: The value separating the higher half of a values from the lower half.

Encrypts data using a key.

Calculate the hash value using an algorithm, and repeat this process for a number of iterations.
